WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
I developed a simple PRISM App using Silverlight 4 and everything worked as expected. But when I changed the project to Silverlight 5 
I started getting the error
"Unable to load one or more of the requested types. Retrieve the LoaderExceptions property for more information."
 
So Does Prism does not support Silverlight 5 ?
 
Regards

Comments.Message:
Hi,

So far we have we have smoke tested the Prism assets against Silverlight 5 and found that they seem to work properly.
As far as I now most of the problems reported regarding this were caused by referenced assemblies that weren't compiled against SL5.

You might find the following discussions useful as they could be related to your problem:

SL5 InteractionRequestTrigger (http://compositewpf.codeplex.com/discussions/282474)
Dynamic Module Loading with MEF in SL5  (http://compositewpf.codeplex.com/discussions/282685)
Does Prism 4 support Silverlight 5 Beta? (http://compositewpf.codeplex.com/discussions/254403)

Please let us know if your scenario is not related to the ones described in the aforementioned discussions. If so it would be helpful if you could provide us with a repro sample application that  portrays this problem, so we can help you further whith this.

Thanks,

Agustin Adami
http://blogs.southworks.net/aadami

Also you might the following blog post useful (http://blogs.msdn.com/b/blaine/archive/2011/12/14/starting-work-on-prism-4-1.aspx) where it says that the p&p team started working on Prism 4.1 which will target Silverlight 5.

Regards,

Agustin Adami
http://blogs.southworks.net/aadami
